recommendations: “Rowland and I worked together in our second year at Oxford Brookes University, in our production of 'Dracula'. As producer Rowland worked tirelessly to ensure that every element of the show looked professional. He made sure that we were being advertised to the university and the general public. Rowland took great care and consideration in his role and he proved to be an invaluable asset to the crew. I would highly recommend him for any work that needs to be done to a high quality level.” Show less

volunteer_experience.info: At the age of 17, I climbed Mount Kilimanjaro for the Zambian charity FlySpec. FlySpec is a flying medical charity which specializes in orthopedic, plastic and reconstructive services in remote areas of Zambia. Along with two others, we raised over £5000 for this very worthy cause and had an incredible experience whilst doing so.
volunteer_experience.subtitle: FlySpec
volunteer_experience.title: Fundraiser

volunteer_experience.info:
.At Oxford Brookes I helped co-found the Oxford Brookes Documentary Club in 2015, a organisation open to the public and university students of Oxford Brookes. .My roles involved social media outreach marketing to publicize screenings of selected documentaries that we acquired licenses for through Facebook, Twitter and local events websites such as Interesting Talks Oxford. .I have also given interviews to promote the organisation on the Oxford Brookes University Radio station…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          .At Oxford Brookes I helped co-found the Oxford Brookes Documentary Club in 2015, a organisation open to the public and university students of Oxford Brookes. .My roles involved social media outreach marketing to publicize screenings of selected documentaries that we acquired licenses for through Facebook, Twitter and local events websites such as Interesting Talks Oxford. .I have also given interviews to promote the organisation on the Oxford Brookes University Radio station, Brookes Radio, and sent out advertisements to BBC Oxford Radio and 96.9 JACK FM Radio. .I am also on hand to introduce selected documentaries at the screenings and am involved in keeping track of members coming to the screenings..In the summer of 2015, I also undertook research to find potential future titles for screenings. The licenses would be bought off distribution companies. This was done by phone calls and email correspondence and included negotiating fees.
            

    
    

    
        Show less
volunteer_experience.subtitle: Oxford Brookes Documentary Club
volunteer_experience.title: Co-Founder and Publicist

volunteer_experience.info:
.During my time as a second year student at Oxford Brookes University I took up the role of the publicist for a student society, the Drama and Improv society. My role was to raise awareness and market the society to the university. The society hosted improv nights which I was involved in marketing through word of mouth, writing and sharing facebook posts and creating facebook event pages for people to know about the improv shows. .On the night of the shows I was also the…
            

    
    

    
        Show more

          
    
  
      

        
          .During my time as a second year student at Oxford Brookes University I took up the role of the publicist for a student society, the Drama and Improv society. My role was to raise awareness and market the society to the university. The society hosted improv nights which I was involved in marketing through word of mouth, writing and sharing facebook posts and creating facebook event pages for people to know about the improv shows. .On the night of the shows I was also the videographer, filming select sketches and would put them on the Drama and Improv Youtube channel. Alongside creating and managing the society Youtube channel I handled and created the official gmail account..The society put on a production of Countess Dracula, an adaptation of Bram Stoker's Dracula. I was assigned the role as the show's​ producer. .My duties involved handling the logistics of booking extra rehearsal time, carrying out line runs, drama warm ups and standing in for rehearsals when the director wasn't around. .Outside of my producer duties, I managed a marketing campaign for the show by recording and editing a teaser of the show for the society youtube channel, giving an interview with the official Oxford Brookes radio station, creating the programme and setting up the facebook event page.  
            

    
    

    
        Show less
volunteer_experience.subtitle: Drama and Improv Society
volunteer_experience.title: Publicist and Production Producer

honors_and_awards.title: Level 3 Certificate in the Arts
honors_and_awards.description: The Level 3 Certificate in the Arts from the Arts Award, recognized as the Gold Arts Award, was awarded during my time at the King's School Ely. It was also an award that I was the first to ever receive at the school.
